html:
Hi!

Several projects have appeared recently that try to solve the "biggest lie" problem, ie. the fact that online Privacy Polices and Terms of Service (ToS) are broken. Almost nobody can read them but everybody has to say they read them. Here's a few such projects: Tossos, CommonTerms, Youluh, StandardLabel, Privacyscore, TosBack, EmanciTerm, Iubenda, Docracy, Customer Commons ... (pls fwd on to others) So a couple of us have gotten together to try and help. 

We believe that all these projects should have a place to meet and coordinate efforts!
A place to find out what others are doing, discuss solutions and problems, find partners (and competitors), liaise with work results, and initiate any standardization work that may be needed. With a first standard proposal already started for an open notice format standard so that all of our work efforts can collaborate. 

To start the collaboration rolling we just created a mailing list and website. If you want to join, please add yourself here:http://groups.google.com/group/opennotice 

Or read more here:
http://www.opennotice.org 

Best regards

Mark Lizar, Identity Trust@Identity Commons, Writer in Collaboration at C4CC, 
Pär Lannerö, CommonTerms/BiggestLie
Reuben Binns, University of Southampton

PS. Conference Call (doodle) Imminent 

--

To unsubscribe from this group, send email to tosdr+unsubscribe@googlegroups.com. For more options, visit this group at https://groups.google.com/d/forum/tosdr?hl=en
 
www.tos-dr.info // www.twitter.com/tosdr // www.github.com/Unhosted/ToS-DR
subject: Coming To Terms
text:
Hi!

Several projects have appeared recently that try to solve the "biggest lie" problem, ie. the fact that online Privacy Polices and Terms of Service (ToS) are broken. Almost nobody can read them but everybody has to say they read them. Here's a few such projects: Tossos, CommonTerms, Youluh, StandardLabel, Privacyscore, TosBack, EmanciTerm, Iubenda, Docracy, Customer Commons ... (pls fwd on to others) So a couple of us have gotten together to try and help. 

We believe that all these projects should have a place to meet and coordinate efforts!
A place to find out what others are doing, discuss solutions and problems, find partners (and competitors), liaise with work results, and initiate any standardization work that may be needed. With a first standard proposal already started for an open notice format standard so that all of our work efforts can collaborate. 

To start the collaboration rolling we just created a mailing list and website. If you want to join, please add yourself here:http://groups.google.com/group/opennotice 

Or read more here:
http://www.opennotice.org 

Best regards

Mark Lizar, Identity Trust@Identity Commons, Writer in Collaboration at C4CC, 
Pär Lannerö, CommonTerms/BiggestLie
Reuben Binns, University of Southampton

PS. Conference Call (doodle) Imminent
